intro: Petalostemon microphyllus, commonly known as the small-leaf petalostemon, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant features small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and its flowers are typically pink or purple, arranged in whorls along the stems. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded to partially shaded environments. The botanical characteristics of this species make it an interesting subject for ecological studies and horticultural cultivation.
